channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Live: Covid-19 updates from New Zealand and the world on 20 August
item.description: New Zealand First is welcoming the deployment of more soldiers at managed isolation facilities, but says defence force bases could be used as quarantine sites.

item.title: More high-level resignations expected at Canterbury DHB - union
item.description: Two more executives are set to resign at the crisis-hit Canterbury District Health Board, according to the senior doctors' union.

item.title: Covid-19: Government urged to launch inquiry into its pandemic response
item.description: The government is being urged to launch an inquiry into its response to the Covid-19 pandemic as soon as the Auckland outbreak is under control.

item.title: University NDAs prompt call for independent complaints authority
item.description: A least a dozen non-disclosure agreements over sexual harassment and bullying complaints have been imposed by New Zealand universities in the last decade.

item.title: District health boards urged to upgrade hospital IT systems in wake of Covid-19
item.description: Director-General of Health Ashley Bloomfield says "very serious consideration" should be given to digital and data projects in the coming year to allow more staff to work from home

item.title: 'Choice between health and economy is a bit of a false dichotomy' - Phil Goff
item.description: Auckland Mayor Phil Goff is hoping the city moves down alert levels after the initial two-week period, but sees a danger in moving too quickly.

item.title: New coroners yet to ease backlog of thousands of cases
item.description: The appointment of eight relief coroners is yet to ease a backlog of cases as grieving families wait up to six years for closure.

item.title: Auckland Covid-19 response: 'We need a Pasifika voice'
item.description: The chair of the Pasifika GP Network is calling on the government to ensure there is a Pacific voice on the new group overseeing testing at the country's border.

item.title: Covid-19: New Zealand's genome scientists tracking the coronavirus
item.description: The Detail - New Zealand scientists are playing a key role in genome testing being used to piece together the puzzle behind the latest coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: Thousands of Aucklanders turning to food banks
item.description: Auckland now has 29 registered food banks, many more than before the Covid-19 pandemic, as increasing job losses wipe out family incomes.

item.title: Mosque shooter sentencing: Authorities not saying if gunman's family will attend
item.description: Authorities are keeping tight-lipped about whether the mosque gunman's family will attend his sentencing.

item.title: Confusion reigns over Covid-19 restrictions for aged care facilities
item.description: The New Zealand Aged Care Association has reiterated its 600 rest homes are still operating at Covid-19 alert level 4, despite that being out of sync with Ministry of Health advice and the actions of some age-care facilities.

item.title: Two people charged after shooting in Christchurch
item.description: A man and a woman are due to appear in court in relation to a shooting in Christchurch.

item.title: Covid-19: What happened in New Zealand on 19 August
item.description: A High Court ruling concluded some of the government's early lockdown measures were unlawful, security at quarantine facilities is being boosted, and a different Covid-19 test is being used to investigate the cluster.

item.title: Covid-19 testing, isolation needs urgent attention - Air NZ staff
item.description: Air New Zealand staff say there are a multitude of loopholes in the airline's border controls - and Covid-19 testing and isolation requirements need urgent attention.

item.title: Nurses offer clue to mystery Covid-19 case at Rydges
item.description: Air Commodore Darryn Webb says the guest at Rydges who had Covid-19 may have passed it on to a nurse who then passed it on to a maintenance man at the facility.

item.title: Covid-19: You can still lick your envelopes - NZ Post
item.description: Some Auckland courier customers may expect delivery delays, after New Zealand Post confirmed two workers at its operations centre in East Tamaki returned positive Covid-19 tests.

item.title: High Court rules some of Covid-19 level 4 lockdown was unlawful
item.description: Attorney-General David Parker says there's been no decision yet on a possible appeal to the high court ruling that some of the country's alert level 4 lockdown was unlawful.
